subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 03 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Lampard appeals to England fans
Frank Lampard calls for England's fans to get behind the team when they face Estonia on Wednesday.



 
Blades confident of reinstatement
Sheffield United plc chairman Kevin McCabe believes the club will be reinstated to the Premiership over the Carlos Tevez affair.



 
McClaren in complacency warning
Coach Steve McClaren says England must guard against complacency when they meet Estonia on Wednesday.








GOLF




Dredge pipped to Wales Open title
South African Richard Sterne wins the Wales Open by a stroke from home favourite Bradley Dredge.



 
Monty buoyant going into US Open
Colin Montgomerie is in confident mood ahead of next week's US Open after ending his Welsh Open with a "perfect" 63.



 
Pampling snatches Memorial lead
Australian Rod Pampling surges into a three-shot lead going into the final round of the Memorial tournament.








MOTORSPORT




Rossi claims sixth Italian GP win
Valentino Rossi wins the Italian MotoGP in Mugello for the sixth year in a row.



 
Gronholm clinches Greece victory
Marcus Gronholm holds off world champion Sebastien Loeb to win the Acropolis Rally for the second year in a row.



 
Stoner claims pole at Italian GP
Championship leader Casey Stoner will start on pole for the Italian MotoGP at Mugello.








FORMULA ONE




Valencia secures F1 street race
Valencia signs its contract to  host a Grand Prix around the Spanish city's streets from 2008.



 
McLaren cleared over Hamilton row
McLaren are cleared of any wrongdoing after an investigation into whether they illegally used team orders in the Monaco Grand Prix.



 
Stewart backs McLaren on Hamilton
F1 great Sir Jackie Stewart says McLaren did the right thing in asking Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton not to race in Monaco.








ATHLETICS




Pickering wins battle of Britain
Craig Pickering wins the battle of the Brits as he storms home in the all-British 100m at the Glasgow Grand Prix.



 
Gay misses out on sprint record
Tyson Gay wins the 100m in New York but is denied a world record as his run was wind-assisted.



 
Wariner targets new 400m record
Jeremy Wariner believes he can break Michael Johnson's 400m world record this season.








CYCLING




Di Luca seals home Giro victory
Danilo di Luca ensures a home victory in the Giro d'Italia for the 11th year running as he cruises home in Milan.



 
Cooke finishes fifth in Montreal 
Nicole Cooke maintains a healthy lead at the top of the World Cup standings despite coming fifth in Canada.



 
Di Luca has sights on Giro prize
Italy's Paolo Savoldelli wins the 20th stage of the Giro d'Italia, leaving Danilo di Luca almost certain to take the overall victory.

Robbo dreams of being a footballing millionaire

Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport
